result.execSummary:
The defendant Kati M. Laplant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence in being

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
DE not to write checks nor have a checking account w/o consent of probation agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Jail term is with huber.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence in being

2:30 pm - DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Kati M. Laplant appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties acknowledge the receipt of revocation packet.  Comments by DA.  DA certifies victims right compliance.  Comments by Atty Lex.  Summation by Court.  Court imposes:

7 months jail with huber cs to any other sentence in being with credit for time served of 71 days
Reimpose all prior monetary obligations with credit for any payments to be paid within 30 days of release from jail or CO

Appeal rights given
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 25, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

11:08 am - DA calls case and states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Kati M. Laplant in court with attorney James Richard Lex.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to count 1.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct 1, and on motion of state, dismisses Ct 2 but it is read in for purposes of restitution.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  DE to submit DNA sample to PRSO.  Court imposes:

Sentence withheld - 1 year probation cs to any other
Conditions of probation
10 days jail with huber
$443 cc
$65 SBDA
$130.74 restitution + $13.07 surcharge for a total of $143.81
DE not to write checks nor have a checkbook w/o consent of probation.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.

Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.

10:59 am - Defendant Kati M. Laplant appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states motion regarding statements filed by defense.  No statements. Adj. 11:00 am.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

Defendant Kati M. Laplant appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
